LOBBYING.Definition: trying to influence or have an effect on politicians

PATRIOTS.Definition: people who feel and show love and loyalty to their country

AMMUNITION.Definition: objects that can be shot or thrown from a gun

BULLETS.Definition: small metal objects that are thrown or shot from a gun

VIGOROUSLY.Definition: in a strong and energetic way

LAWMAKERS.Definition: politicians who are responsible for making laws

LEGISLATORS.Definition: politicians who are responsible for making laws

BANS.Definition: legal prohibitions or the actions of not allowing something

PEACETIME.Definition: a period of time when the country is not at war

SPRAWLING.Definition: spread over a large amount of people

CONTRIBUTIONS.Definition: payments given in order to help make something successful

INTEREST-GROUPS.Definition: groups whose goal is to influence or have an effect on the government

PERSUADE.Definition: make someone want to do something

ON THE FLIP SIDE OF THIS.Definition: on the opposite side of this

GRASSROOTS.Definition: that encourage people to support a goal

TRIED AND TESTED.Definition: something that has proven effective in the past

SYMPATHY.Definition: feelings of understanding and care for someone else's suffering

SPOKESPEOPLE.Definition: a person who speaks officially for an organisation

ENSHRINED.Definition: protected and respected as something holy

GROTESQUELY.Definition: in an unpleasant and bad way

SEMI-AUTOMATIC RIFLE.Definition: a gun that auto reloads after a bullet is fired

DRIVER.Definition: a fact that causes something to happen

BANKRUPTCY.Definition: the situation in which an organisation cannot pay its debts

ABUSING.Definition: using something for the wrong purpose

POLARISING.Definition: dividing people into two groups, each supporting an opposite opinion

AMBITIONS.Definition: strong wishes to achieve their goals

HOT TOPIC.Definition: a subject that a lot of people are discussing
